properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Fernandina Beach to St. Augustine FL out 20 NM; Waters from Fernandina Beach to St. Augustine FL from 20 to 60 NM; Waters from St. Augustine to Flagler Beach FL from 20 to 60 NM; Coastal waters from St. Augustine to Flagler Beach FL out 20 NM
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 12 at 12:47PM EST by NWS Jacksonville FL
properties.description:
The areas affected include...
Coastal waters from Fernandina Beach to St. Augustine FL out 20
NM...
Coastal waters from St. Augustine to Flagler Beach FL out 20 NM...
Waters from Fernandina Beach to St. Augustine FL from 20 to 60
NM...
Waters from St. Augustine to Flagler Beach FL from 20 to 60 NM...

A bank of sea fog will continue to impact the northeast Florida
Atlantic waters through mid afternoon from roughly offshore of Ponte
Vedra Beach southward to Flagler Beach. The fog bank extends
offshore up to 40 NM. Visibility will be below 1 NM at times. Later
this afternoon, the fog may begin to move back onshore as winds
shift more southeast with the east coast sea breeze, then the fog
would impact inland estuaries.
properties.instruction:
Mariners can expect gusty winds to around 30 knots, locally higher
waves, and lightning strikes. Boaters should seek safe harbor
immediately until this storm passes.

Dense fog was reducing visibilities to below 1 mile. Reduce your
speed, and keep a lookout for other vessels, buoys, and breakwaters.
Keep your navigation lights on. If not equipped with radar, you
should consider seeking safe harbor.

NWSheadline: SEA FOG OVER PORTIONS OF THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA ATLANTIC WATERS
